modules.description: This module provides operations to construct and manipulate individual track entries within a cuesheet, focusing on metadata (titles, performers, composers), temporal properties (indexes, gaps, durations), and format-specific flags. It works with track records containing time indices represented via `Duration.t`, alongside `CueTrackMode` and `CueTrackFlag` enumerations to define playback behavior and encoding settings. Typical use cases include authoring cuesheets for audio archives, where precise timing adjustments, embedded comments, or structured metadata per track are required.

This module defines track mode types for specifying the data format of individual tracks in a cuesheet. It includes functions to convert track modes to strings and compare them. These modes are used to indicate how track data is structured, such as audio, CDG, or various CD-ROM formats.

This module defines a polymorphic variant type `duration` with three time representation formats: minute-second (MS), minute-second-millisecond (MSM), and minute-second-frame (MSF). It provides functions to construct durations in each format, convert between formats, and perform addition of durations, ensuring consistent output in MSF format. The module is used to accurately represent and manipulate time offsets and track lengths when generating cuesheets for audio files.

This module represents and manipulates cue sheets, supporting operations to add metadata such as title, performer, catalog, and track information. It works with strings, custom types from related modules (like CueTrack and CueFileFormat), and optional parameters to build and export a cue sheet. Concrete use cases include generating cue files for audio CDs, embedding disc metadata, and organizing track listings with associated time offsets and flags.

This module defines a set of supported file formats that a cuesheet can reference, including BINARY, MOTOROLA, AIFF, WAVE, and MP3. It provides functions to convert these format values to strings and to compare them. These representations are used when specifying the file type in cuesheet metadata or when validating input formats for track files.

This module defines track encoding flags used in cuesheets, including PRE, DCP, F_4CH, and SCMS. It provides functions to convert these flags to strings and compare them. These flags specify audio encoding characteristics for individual tracks in a cuesheet.

This module creates cue sheets for audio files by handling track metadata, time representations, and format-specific settings. It supports operations to define tracks with precise durations, encoding flags, and file formats, working with polymorphic variants for time and enumerated types for track modes. Concrete use cases include authoring cue files for CD images, organizing multi-track audio archives, and embedding structured metadata with accurate timing information.
